results.title: Spelling Bee Forum
results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.adx_keywords: Life-Sustaining Support Systems, Withdrawal Of;Parenting;Death and Dying;Decisions and Verdicts;Families and Family Life;Coma;Children and Childhood;Battersbee, Archie;Evans, Alfie;Gard, Charlie (2016- );Great Britain;Essex (England)
results.title: Archie Battersbee, Gravely Ill 12-Year-Old, Dies After Removal of Life Support
results.abstract: The boy’s family had made several legal appeals to keep him on a ventilator, but judges in Britain sided with doctors in finding that he had no hope of recovery.

media.caption: Hollie Dance, second left, the mother of Archie Battersbee, was surrounded by family and friends outside the Royal London Hospital on Saturday as she spoke to the news media after his death.
media.copyright: Aaron Chown/Press Association, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Space and Astronomy;Private Spaceflight;Rocket Science and Propulsion;Musk, Elon;Defense Department;Federal Aviation Administration;National Aeronautics and Space Administration;Space Exploration Technologies Corp;Australia
results.byline: By Mike Ives and Jenny Gross
results.title: A Large Object Landed on His Sheep Farm. It Came From Space.
results.abstract: “It’s not something you see every day on a sheep farm,” a farmer said of the pieces of debris that wound up in rural Australia. They are thought to be from a SpaceX spacecraft.

media.caption: A sheepherder in Dalgety, Australia, stumbled upon a tall piece of space junk, said to be debris from the SpaceX Crew-1 spacecraft.

results.byline: By Mitch Smith and Julie Bosman
results.title: Indiana Governor Signs First Post-Roe Abortion Ban, With Limited Exceptions
results.abstract: The law passed despite dividing Republicans. Some of them said the measure was too restrictive; others objected to limited exceptions for rape and incest.

media.caption: People watching from the gallery before a vote was held on Senate Bill 1 during a special session on Friday at the Indiana Statehouse in Indianapolis.
media.copyright: Jenna Watson/The Indianapolis Star, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Swimming Pools;Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Sustainable Living;Water;Airbnb;Austin (Tex);British Columbia (Canada);California;New Hampshire
results.title: Don’t Call It a Swimming Pool
results.abstract: Plunge pools have become an alternative for homeowners who want a simple, less expensive way to cool off.

media.caption: “We really wanted just a ‘cocktail pool’ that we could dip in, have some drinks, have some friends over. We just didn’t want a big pool,” said homeowner Amy Holland, whose plunge pool (seen here) did not interfere with the lengthy root system of the 100-year-old live oak on the property.
media.copyright: Katherine Squier for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Child Abandonment;Babies and Infants;Adoptions;Abortion;Parenting;Roe v Wade (Supreme Court Decision);Alito, Samuel A Jr;Barrett, Amy Coney;Supreme Court (US);Carmel (Ind);Indiana
results.title: Drop Box for Babies: Conservatives Promote a Way to Give Up Newborns Anonymously
results.abstract: After Roe, groups are seeking to expand safe haven laws, which allow women to surrender babies with minimal interference. But these laws pose their own problems.

media.caption: It looks like a library book drop, but it’s really a place for parents to surrender their newborns.
media.copyright: Kaiti Sullivan for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Solitary Confinement;Books and Literature;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Woodfox, Albert;Louisiana State Penitentiary
results.title: Albert Woodfox, Survivor of 42 Years in Solitary Confinement, Dies at 75
results.abstract: His term in solitary was perhaps the longest in American history. He described how he kept his sanity, and dignity, in an acclaimed memoir.

media.caption: Albert Woodfox after his release from prison in 2016. A federal judge said there was nothing “remotely comparable in the annals of American jurisprudence” to Mr. Woodfox’s 42 years in solitary confinement.
media.copyright: Bryan Tarnowski for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Walking;Diabetes;Exercise;Diet and Nutrition;Sugar;Research;Content Type: Service;Sports Medicine (Journal)
results.title: Just 2 Minutes of Walking After a Meal Is Surprisingly Good for You
results.abstract: A new paper suggests that it takes far less exercise than was previously thought to lower blood sugar after eating.

media.caption: A short walk can have a significant impact on blood sugar levels.

results.adx_keywords: Books and Literature;Parenting;Actors and Actresses;Content Type: Personal Profile;Cosgrove, Miranda;Grande, Ariana;McCurdy, Jennette (1992- );Nickelodeon
results.title: Jennette McCurdy Is Ready to Move Forward, and to Look Back
results.abstract: In her memoir, “I’m Glad My Mom Died,” McCurdy, best known for her role in“iCarly,” reflects on her time as a child actor and on her troubled relationship with her mother.

media.caption: Jennette McCurdy’s relationship with her mother is the narrative force at the center of her memoir: “It’s the heartbeat of my life.”
media.copyright: Ahmed Gaber for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2024;United States Politics and Government;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Trump, Donald J;Democratic Party
results.title: Hey, Joe, Don’t Give It a Go
results.abstract: Rest on your laurels, and don’t run for re-election, Mr. President.

results.adx_keywords: Suits and Litigation (Civil);Compensation for Damages (Law);Newtown, Conn, Shooting (2012);Conspiracy Theories;Libel and Slander;Decisions and Verdicts;Jones, Alex (1974- );Lewis, Scarlett;Lewis, Jesse;Heslin, Neil;Infowars
results.byline: By Elizabeth Williamson, Tiffany Hsu and Michael Levenson
results.title: Jury Orders Alex Jones to Pay $45.2 Million in Sandy Hook Case
results.abstract: The parents of a child killed in the school shooting were awarded the punitive damages at the conclusion of the defamation trial against the conspiracy theorist.

media.caption: Testimony on Friday indicated that Alex Jones and a company he controls were worth $135 million to $270 million.

results.adx_keywords: United States Economy;Economic Conditions and Trends;Prices (Fares, Fees and Rates);internal-storyline-no;Buenos Aires (Argentina);Argentina
results.byline: By Jack Nicas, Ana Lankes and Sebastián López Brach
results.title: Think 9% Inflation Is Bad? Try 90%.
results.abstract: With the world grappling with rising prices, a tour through Argentina reveals that years of inflation can give rise to a truly bizarre economy.

media.caption: Argentina has dealt with rapidly rising prices for much of the past 50 years. People have been left with little idea of how much things should cost.

results.title: After a First Date at Popeyes, Marriage Was on the Menu
results.abstract: Sharhea Wade was ready to forget about Stevenson Boyce, whom she met on Hinge, because he twice canceled their first date. But soon after a third (successful) attempt, she was ready to marry him.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Political Advertising;Primaries and Caucuses;Cheney, Liz;Cheney, Dick;Trump, Donald J;Wyoming
results.title: Dick Cheney excoriates Trump in an ad for his daughter Liz Cheney.
results.abstract: The one-minute ad landed with a bang on social media, but in Wyoming, it is highly unlikely to sway any significant number of voters in Ms. Cheney’s favor.

media.caption: “I proudly voted for my daughter,” former Vice President Dick Cheney said in a new ad for Representative Liz Cheney’s re-election campaign. “I hope you will, too.”

results.adx_keywords: United States Economy;Recession and Depression;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Labor and Jobs;Inflation (Economics);Prices (Fares, Fees and Rates);Consumer Behavior;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Federal Reserve System;Williston (ND)
results.title: How This Economic Moment Rewrites the Rules
results.abstract: Jobs aplenty. Sizzling demand. If the United States is headed into a recession, it is taking an unusual route, with many markers of a boom.

media.caption: Housing was so scarce in Williston, N.D., in 2010 that workers flocking to the area for jobs during the oil boom resorted to living in campers on the edge of town.

results.adx_keywords: States (US);Law and Legislation;Abortion;Politics and Government;Roe v Wade (Supreme Court Decision);Cummins Inc;Eli Lilly and Company;Roche Holding AG;Salesforce.com Inc;Indiana
results.title: Major Indiana Employers Criticize State’s New Abortion Law
results.abstract: The drug company Eli Lilly said it “will be forced” to look outside the state for employment growth. The engine maker Cummins said the law will “impede our ability to attract and retain top talent.”

media.caption: Eli Lilly’s corporate headquarters in Indianapolis.

results.title: The 50 Best TV Shows on Netflix Right Now
results.abstract: New shows come to the streaming giant all the time — too many to ever watch them all. We’re here to help.

media.caption: From left, Ken Bolden, Sandra Oh and Mark Philip Stevenson in a scene from “The Chair.”

results.adx_keywords: Books and Literature;Photography;Libraries and Librarians;New York Public Library;New York City
results.title: Reading Around New York
results.abstract: Even amid the clamor of a city of millions, New Yorkers have always been able to escape into a good book.

media.caption: The New York Public Library in 1979.

results.title: ‘Something Is Wrong Here.’ More Than 100 Local Residents Had Brain Tumors, but What Was the Cause?
results.abstract: The complicated nature of cancer cluster investigations.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: After Al Lupiano, his wife and his sister developed brain tumors, he reached out to former classmates at their New Jersey high school to see if they had similar problems. “Something is wrong here,” he said.
media.copyright: Bryan Anselm for The New York Times

results.title: A.I. Is Not Sentient. Why Do People Say It Is?
results.abstract: Robots can’t think or feel, despite what the researchers who build them want to believe.

media.caption: Desdemona, a robot designed and built by Ben Goertzel, performs in Mr. Goertzel’s band.
